item.title: Tree uprooted and pavement issue, 20th August
item.description:
Hello there, I know this problem has been reported before but I thought I would add a couple of photos for context. I also wanted you to see the pavement has been uprooted and is most certainly a trip Hazard. Can the tree please be re planted and pavement set right again, thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lynwood Grove, Crofton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Urgent Safety Concern – Unsafe Bike Parking Outside Adelaide Wharg, 20th August
item.description:
Our high-risk building faces serious danger from e-bikes/scooters parked outside and under balconies. Lithium battery fires are volatile and access is obstructed. I urge Hackney Council & LFB to act: ban parking here and provide safe alternatives urgently

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Queensbridge Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic detector Occasionally comms do improve but not long enough to to gain ATC. Poor comms is being caused by a poor line sight from overgrown trees. Requires Council to cut back trees to improve line of sight. Please allow exception for Council to be contacted and tress cut back., 20th August
item.description:
Traffic detector Occasionally comms do improve but not long enough to to gain ATC. Poor comms is being caused by a poor line sight from overgrown trees. Requires Council to cut back trees to improve line of sight. Please allow exception for Council to be contacted and tress cut back.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, Seymour Street, Marylebone, London
